0.085	0.546	0.041	0.082	0.039	0.04	0.082	0.043	0.04

Raw frequency (temporal sequences):
958, 6149, 461, 924, 444, 454, 928, 484, 455,

% chance of each stimulus occuring after another:
0.085	0.546	0.041	0.082	0.039	0.04	0.082	0.043	0.04
0.086	0.039	0.547	0.082	0.044	0.041	0.08	0.041	0.04
0.164	0.087	0.084	0.163	0.084	0.086	0.164	0.083	0.085
0.085	0.042	0.04	0.085	0.551	0.039	0.08	0.037	0.04
0.083	0.044	0.04	0.083	0.039	0.548	0.084	0.04	0.04
0.168	0.082	0.085	0.164	0.084	0.083	0.16	0.088	0.085
0.084	0.042	0.04	0.084	0.042	0.041	0.079	0.547	0.04
0.088	0.04	0.041	0.084	0.041	0.039	0.084	0.041	0.542
0.171	0.082	0.087	0.166	0.08	0.081	0.164	0.083	0.087

Given a stimulus X, the chance that it occured from a sequence is 50%. E.g. for A, P(Seq|Saw A) = P(A was part of sequence)/P(A occuring) = (1/4 * 1/3) / (1/4 * 1/3 + 3/4 * 1/9) = (1/12) / (1/6) = 1/2. 

So, given a certain stimulus at time t, if it's not the last one in a sequence, the chance that at t+1 the stimulus is the next one in the sequence is: 
.5(1)Â + .5(.75(.11)) = .54

The chance that at t+1 the stimulus is not the next one, but is one that starts a different sequence (e.g. A, D, or G), is:
.5(0) + .5(.75(.11) + .25(.33)) = .08

The chance that at t+1 the stimulus is not the next one, nor one that starts a different sequence, is:
.5(0) + .5(.75(.11)) = .04

If the stimulus seen at time t was the last in a sequence, then the current state doesn't matter (since there's nothing left in the sequence). So the chance that the next stimulus will be A, D, or G is:
.75(.11) + .25(.33) = .167
And the chance it will be a different stiulus is:
.75(.11) = .08

The probabilities are borne out in the matrix above. E.g., at (0, 1), (1, 2), (3, 4) and so on the probabilities are ~54%. At (2, 0), (5,0) and so on, the probability is ~17%, and so on. 

In contrast:
Randomly generated stimuli (raw frequency):
1230, 1280, 1258, 1218, 1273, 1194, 1288, 1294, 1225, 
1269, 1285, 1233, 1167, 1272, 1217, 1206, 1199, 1303, 
1286, 1219, 1160, 1202, 1247, 1245, 1209, 1202, 1128, 
1233, 1178, 1213, 1228, 1174, 1195, 1221, 1222, 1240, 
1243, 1264, 1227, 1190, 1283, 1248, 1281, 1241, 1232, 
1242, 1227, 1242, 1190, 1185, 1281, 1215, 1266, 1243, 
1242, 1219, 1162, 1227, 1298, 1233, 1251, 1239, 1239, 
1254, 1226, 1233, 1253, 1238, 1210, 1198, 1266, 1256, 
1261, 1253, 1169, 1230, 1239, 1268, 1241, 1205, 1276,

0.11	0.111	0.113	0.111	0.109	0.108	0.114	0.113
0.112	0.105	0.11	0.111	0.114	0.111	0.108	0.115

= 1/9 for any stimulus to follow another.
